content:
• Thursday, January 26, 2012
  • TRQ

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN) gains 3.8% AH after Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) confirms through a 13D filing it...

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN) gains 3.8% AH after Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) confirms through a 13D filing it has a 51% stake in Ivanhoe. Rio Tinto adds it's engaged in "a review of the composition of the Company’s board of directors and management," and plans to replace certain board and management figures. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK -11.4%) had a bad day, mostly thanks to the soft guidance that followed its Q4...

    SanDisk (SNDK -11.4%) had a bad day, mostly thanks to the soft guidance that followed its Q4 report (I, II). With SanDisk partly blaming the guidance on "demand weakness from certain mobile OEM customers" (HTC is likely one of them), it's possible the company could be a victim of Apple's success. However, UBS is remaining bullish on account of SSD demand, a low valuation, and a favorable supply/demand balance.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) falls 3.1% AH after filing for a $100M mixed shelf offering....

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) falls 3.1% AH after filing for a $100M mixed shelf offering. Chelsea, which announced a $20M offering 3 weeks ago, only says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) guides on its earnings call (webcast) for Q1 revenue of $187M-$197M...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) guides on its earnings call (webcast) for Q1 revenue of $187M-$197M ($195.4M consensus) and EPS of $0.31-$0.34 ($0.33 consensus). The company is also widening its 2012 EPS guidance range to $1.54-$1.64 ($1.57-$1.64 prior), but is leaving its sales guidance unchanged. Informatica, whose shares have struggled since Oracle's FQ2 miss, is up 5.9% AH. (Q4 results)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • ELX

    More on Emulex's FQ2: Though revenue was only in-line, the maker of storage adapter cards and...

    More on Emulex's FQ2: Though revenue was only in-line, the maker of storage adapter cards and switches had raised its guidance earlier in the month. The Street is pleased with FQ3 guidance for revenue of $121M-$125M and EPS of $0.17-$0.19, largely above a consensus of $121M and $0.17. ELX +6.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) jumps 5.2% AH after a judge says the company is indemnified against most...

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) jumps 5.2% AH after a judge says the company is indemnified against most of the claims made against it related to the Deepwater Horizon disaster. However, Transocean is still considered exposed to punitive damage claims and Clean Water Act penalties. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) +3% AH after announcing an increase in its quarterly dividend and a buyback...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) +3% AH after announcing an increase in its quarterly dividend and a buyback of $1B of its common stock in addition to the $900M remaining on a previous $2B authorization. The data-storage maker expects to fund the dividend and share repurchases through cash on hand, future cash flow from operations and potential alternative sources of financing.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) guides on its earnings call (webcast) for Q1 revenue of  $183M-$187M...

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) guides on its earnings call (webcast) for Q1 revenue of  $183M-$187M and EPS of $0.19-$0.20, below a consensus of $197.1M and $0.25. It blames the shortfall on a "product transition," but fears of competitive issues are likely on many investors' minds. Shares now -13.5% AH, adding to the decline seen following the release of Riverbed's Q4 report (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • BVSN

    Looks like the party is over for BroadVision (BVSN -9%) Shares are down another 13.8% AH after...

    Looks like the party is over for BroadVision (BVSN -9%) Shares are down another 13.8% AH after the company, which mysteriously surged during much of January, reported Q4 revenue of  $4.2M (-18% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.30 ($0.14 profit in year-ago period). There are no consensus estimates due to a lack of analyst coverage. BroadVision shares are now down 57% from their Tuesday high.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • RVBD

    More on Riverbed's Q4: EMEA sales rose 17% Q/Q and 36% Y/Y, further evidence (previously) that...

    More on Riverbed's Q4: EMEA sales rose 17% Q/Q and 36% Y/Y, further evidence (previously) that Riverbed has put to rest the execution issues that had earlier affected EMEA sales. However, sales to the U.S. rose only 2.5% Q/Q in a seasonally strong quarter, which could add to existing fears of slowing demand within the country. Deferred revenue rose 7% Q/Q, to $157.4M. RVBD -10.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • CPHD

    More on Cepheid's (NASDAQ:CPHD) Q4: Cites strong demand for its GeneXpert systems, despite tight...

    More on Cepheid's (NASDAQ:CPHD) Q4: Cites strong demand for its GeneXpert systems, despite tight capital in U.S. and Europe. Sets 2012 revenue guidance at $333M-$347M. Sees EPS falling in a range of $0.55 to $0.60. Shares +19.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • ERIC

    More on Juniper's Q4: The soft Q1 forecast, together with Ericsson's (NASDAQ:ERIC) weak results,...

    More on Juniper's Q4: The soft Q1 forecast, together with Ericsson's (NASDAQ:ERIC) weak results, indicate the 2012 telecom capex environment is looking bleak. Juniper's service provider sales fell 14% Y/Y in Q4, more than offsetting a 9% increase in enterprise sales. Asia-Pac was particularly weak, with overall sales falling 20%. One unanswered question is the extent to which competition from Cisco is taking a toll. JNPR -6.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $204M (+23% Y/Y)...

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $204M (+23% Y/Y) beats by $3.2M. Shares -3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): Q4 EPS of $0.28 in-line. Revenue of $1.12B (-6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): Q4 EPS of $0.28 in-line. Revenue of $1.12B (-6% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Expects Q1 revenue of $960M-$990M, below $1.1B consensus. Expects Q1 EPS of $0.11-$0.14, below $0.26 consensus. Shares -5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • SODA

    SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) fell off 4.3% on the same report (I, II) concerning Wal-Mart's plan to...

    SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) fell off 4.3% on the same report (I, II) concerning Wal-Mart's plan to offer a single-serve coffee system that hit shares of Green Mountain Coffee hard.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALK

    Alaska Air (ALK -3.8%) takes a hit after its Q4 EPS missed the mark due to significantly higher...

    Alaska Air (ALK -3.8%) takes a hit after its Q4 EPS missed the mark due to significantly higher fuel costs. As with the rest of its peers in the airline industry, the airline has seen recent results hampered by steep costs to fuel its planes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -6.6%) is lowered to Underweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan amid...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -6.6%) is lowered to Underweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan amid continued concerns about its 2012 funding gap. "We now think there are few 2012 catalysts to help the stock outperform," the firm says as CHK shares slide after a four-session, 13% jump after news of the natural gas producer's planned retrenchment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -5.2%) trades lower on a downgrade to Market Perform on valuation by...

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -5.2%) trades lower on a downgrade to Market Perform on valuation by Raymond James, citing a lack of near term catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • DOV

    Dover (DOV +2.9%) is raised to Buy from Hold by Stifel Nicolaus, citing "balance sheet capacity...

    Dover (DOV +2.9%) is raised to Buy from Hold by Stifel Nicolaus, citing "balance sheet capacity for meaningful accretive acquisitions" in the near future, low relative exposure to Europe, and a positive view on DOV's management given portfolio improvements in the past four years. The firm notes 2012 guidance is "significantly better" than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • STI

    Deutsche Bank downgrades SunTrust Banks (STI -5.6%) to Hold from Buy because expenses were...

    Deutsche Bank downgrades SunTrust Banks (STI -5.6%) to Hold from Buy because expenses were higher than expected in Q4 and may not decline meaningfully until late 2012, but adds that upside to STI's earnings and share price could be meaningful longer term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • ETN

    Diversified industrial manufacturer Eaton (ETN -1.5%) trades lower after missing its Q4...

    Diversified industrial manufacturer Eaton (ETN -1.5%) trades lower after missing its Q4 estimates on all fronts due to slower-than-expected sales and acquisition expenses. The company also lowered its outlook for FQ1, now expecting to earn $0.80 per share, below analysts expectations for $0.97.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • FTNT

    It's a wild ride for Fortinet (FTNT -0.5%) after its share price flew down 12% - tripping...

    It's a wild ride for Fortinet (FTNT -0.5%) after its share price flew down 12% - tripping circuit breakers along the way - then shot right back up to their previous level within the half hour. Trader chatter attributes the movement to an off-exchange trade that was unrelated to corporate news.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • NFLX

    Whitney Tilson, who reversed his bearish stance on Netflix (NFLX +21.7%) last fall after missing...

    Whitney Tilson, who reversed his bearish stance on Netflix (NFLX +21.7%) last fall after missing the stock’s huge drop, takes a victory lap after the stock’s spike following stronger-than-expected Q4 results. In a letter to his followers, he praises the "complete turnaround" in NFLX’s streaming video subscribers while ridiculing bears. J.C. Penney (JCP +17.2%) is lookin' good too.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 6 Comments
  • KMT

    Kennametal (KMT -1%) gives back the day's early gains and more, despite reporting an FQ2 EPS...

    Kennametal (KMT -1%) gives back the day's early gains and more, despite reporting an FQ2 EPS that easily beat estimates on double-digit growth in its aerospace and defense business. The company also raises its outlook for the fiscal year, saying it now expects to post earnings of between $3.70 - $3.90 per share versus a prior forecast of $3.60 - $3.85.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • RCPI

    Shares of Star Scientific (CIGX) spike 27% higher on speculation that litigation with R.J....

    Shares of Star Scientific (CIGX) spike 27% higher on speculation that litigation with R.J. Reynolds (RAI -1.1%) may be settled shortly after a judge is appointed to the case.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • CRR

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR -19.8%) joins Halliburton (NYSE:HAL), Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) and RPC...

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR -19.8%) joins Halliburton (NYSE:HAL), Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) and RPC (NYSE:RES) in warning of lower capital spending on natural gas projects that could upset the plans of companies providing drilling and related services to oil and gas producers. "The growth of activity in liquids-rich plays contributed to logistical issues in the industry" during Q4, CRR says. (submitted by Michael Filloon)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • HCA

    HCA falls 2.2% after Auriga downgrades shares to Hold. The firm believes the macro issues facing...

    HCA falls 2.2% after Auriga downgrades shares to Hold. The firm believes the macro issues facing HCA and other hospital operators, such as fewer surgeries, reimbursement challenges, and slow GDP growth, haven't fully disappeared, and are likely to remain over the next 12 months. With shares up strongly in January, Auriga doesn't consider their risk/reward profile compelling.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • P

    Broadcast radio shoots back at Pandora (P +2.8%) via its favorite mouthpiece, Arbitron...

    Broadcast radio shoots back at Pandora (P +2.8%) via its favorite mouthpiece, Arbitron (NYSE:ARB). The ratings service releases data saying listeners spend 14.6B hours per month with terrestrial radio vs. Pandora's 2.1B in Q3 2011. But due to scale - e.g., number of stations - those numbers might not compare. (submitted by Rocco Pendola)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -2.8%) CEO Dan Dinges blasts the EPA's testing of water wells near...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -2.8%) CEO Dan Dinges blasts the EPA's testing of water wells near its Dimock, Pa., shale gas formations as "politically motivated." Dinges says state regulators have already determined that Dimock meets drinking water regulatory standards, and the EPA told residents that drinking water was not threatened just last month. (submitted by Michael Filloon)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • ENMD

    Shares of microcap drug developer EntreMed (ENMD +23%) soar on the back of partner Celgene's...

    Shares of microcap drug developer EntreMed (ENMD +23%) soar on the back of partner Celgene's (CELG -1.4%) acquisition of fellow cancer-therapy developer Avila Therapeutics. The company derives most of its revenue from royalty payments on sales of Celgene's drug Thalomid.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • GMCR

    More on Green Mountain Coffee's (GMCR -3.7%) decline: The specific cause is a Detwiler Fenton...

    More on Green Mountain Coffee's (GMCR -3.7%) decline: The specific cause is a Detwiler Fenton report claming Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) will launch a single-server brewer in partnership with Esio Beverage, and its coffee cup prices will undercut those for Green Mountain's K-Cups. The firm adds Green Mountain's next-gen V-Cup brewer, which it hopes will limit the impact of patent expirations, will see limited traction in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • PCP

    Precision Castparts (PCP -3.7%) trades down after its FQ3 misses across the board. Earnings...

    Precision Castparts (PCP -3.7%) trades down after its FQ3 misses across the board. Earnings jumped 14% Y/Y bouyed by solid sales gains in its aerospace and forged product segments, but bottom line numbers were hit by a higher than anticipated jump in expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • RGS

    Regis (RGS +5.7%) climbs on a FQ2 earnings beat, despite swinging to a loss on a significant...

    Regis (RGS +5.7%) climbs on a FQ2 earnings beat, despite swinging to a loss on a significant goodwill write-down and weaker-than-expected same-store sales. The company also lowers its operational earnings estimate for the year, now forecasting $1.11 - $1.21 per share, down from its previous view of $1.16 - $1.32, and adds that it expects negative same-store sales for the year as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MUR

    Shares of Murphy Oil (MUR +4.1%) move higher after CEO David Wood tips off on an earnings CC...

    Shares of Murphy Oil (MUR +4.1%) move higher after CEO David Wood tips off on an earnings CC that the company may spin off its downstream division - parent of 1,128 convenience stores.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • LYTS

    LSI Industries (LYTS -3.8%) dips after its FQ2 comes in below estimates on an 8% Y/Y decline in...

    LSI Industries (LYTS -3.8%) dips after its FQ2 comes in below estimates on an 8% Y/Y decline in revenue. Although its lighting segment profit increased, particularly in LED video screen-related sales, the gains were largely offset by a significant decline in its graphics and electronics component units.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • TIVO

    Shares of TiVO (NASDAQ:TIVO) perk up after word comes in that the company landed an order...

    Shares of TiVO (NASDAQ:TIVO) perk up after word comes in that the company landed an order lifting the stay in its patent suit against Verizon (VZ -0.5%). After spiking over 3% higher after the judge's ruling broke, shares are back on the retreat and sit down 1.1% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • IVZ

    Invesco (IVZ +3.3%) gains after reporting Q4 revenue that easily beat expectations. Earnings...

    Invesco (IVZ +3.3%) gains after reporting Q4 revenue that easily beat expectations. Earnings jumped 16% Y/Y as the money manager logged lower expenses and fewer charges, offsetting a reduction in investment management, service and distribution fees.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • TZOO

    Shares of Travelzoo (TZOO -8.6%) slide after it misses on Q4 revenue estimates, despite a 23%...

    Shares of Travelzoo (TZOO -8.6%) slide after it misses on Q4 revenue estimates, despite a 23% Y/Y jump in earnings. The online publisher of travel and entertainment deals actually saw double-digit subscriber and revenue growth, particularly in Europe, but gross margins bit into its bottom line, falling to 89.5% from 92.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • CY

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY -4.8%) shares sink after the company's conference call lowers guidance...

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY -4.8%) shares sink after the company's conference call lowers guidance on Q1 EPS to $0.15-$0.18 vs. $0.25 consensus, and revenue to $200M-$210M vs. $228M consensus. CY warns revenue will decrease at a rate greater than normal, and bookings and revenue "will bottom out" during the period. (earlier: Q4 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • UAL

    United Continental (UAL +7.5%) ramps up after its Q4 easily beat EPS estimates. Losses narrowed...

    United Continental (UAL +7.5%) ramps up after its Q4 easily beat EPS estimates. Losses narrowed on strong revenue, and would have actually shown a profit except for a raft of one-time charges mostly related to integration expenses to combine the two airlines.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • VAR

    Varian Medical Systems (VAR -2.4%) dips after reporting a mixed FQ1 as earnings fell by 6.5% Y/Y...

    Varian Medical Systems (VAR -2.4%) dips after reporting a mixed FQ1 as earnings fell by 6.5% Y/Y and margins slipped. The company also issued a downbeat second-quarter growth outlook, now expecting EPS growth of 12% to 13% and a revenue increase of 8%. The Street view is for 16.7% EPS growth and 10% revenue growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • HUM

    Health insurance providers sell off after House Democrats release a GAO report (.pdf) that...

    Health insurance providers sell off after House Democrats release a GAO report (.pdf) that claims Medicare Advantage plans were overpaid by $1.2B-$3.1B in 2010, with excess payments continuing to grow afterwards. HUM -3.2%. UAM -4.5%. WLP -2.4%. UNH -2.7%. CI -2.8%.  Cuts to Medicare Advantage are widely expected. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • CSIQ

    Shares of Canadian Solar (CSIQ +11.6%) rally after the company says it will supply more than 1.5...

    Shares of Canadian Solar (CSIQ +11.6%) rally after the company says it will supply more than 1.5 MW of solar modules to Al Fahad Group, which is building a large solar project in Abu Dhabi. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) may be streaming 22% ahead today following its Q4 results, but analysts...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) may be streaming 22% ahead today following its Q4 results, but analysts from Pacific Crest, Morgan Stanley and Canaccord Genuity remain skeptical, particularly with Amazon and other rivals in the rear-view mirror. MarketBeat rounds up the reaction.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • NVR

    NVR (NVR -4.1%) posted a big Q4 miss today, colliding with weak new home sales report to help...

    NVR (NVR -4.1%) posted a big Q4 miss today, colliding with weak new home sales report to help drag the entire sector lower. Earnings fell 45% Y/Y as the homebuilder closed on 9.6% fewer homes during the period, and saw a drop in homebuilding revenue due to tightening margins and ongoing pricing pressures.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • TRI

    Thomson Reuters (TRI -2.1%) sells off thanks to a downgrade to Sell from Goldman. The firm is...

    Thomson Reuters (TRI -2.1%) sells off thanks to a downgrade to Sell from Goldman. The firm is worried about Thomson Reuters' strong dependence on both the financial services industry in general, and European financial customers in particular. It believes bank job cuts will lead to a 3%-5% Y/Y decline in the user base for the company's Markets products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • NBGGY

    As Angela Merkel says debt restructuring talks remain on track, performance of Greek stocks...

    As Angela Merkel says debt restructuring talks remain on track, performance of Greek stocks appears to anticipate a positive announcement out of Europe. National Bank of Greece (NBG +15.2%) continues to perform well, adding to this month's monster gains. Money is betting that a default won't happen, and that's likely a good thing for the risk-on environment. (submitted by Michael Gayed)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • NOK

    Though off its highs, Nokia (NOK +3.8%) remains up after posting its Q4 report. Possibly...

    Though off its highs, Nokia (NOK +3.8%) remains up after posting its Q4 report. Possibly encouraging investors is a 7% Q/Q increase in Nokia's smartphone ASP, to €140. While still well below Apple's ASP, the increase boosted Nokia's operating margin, and raises hopes that ASPs will continue rising as shipments of Nokia's Windows Phones (costlier, on average, than its Symbian phones) ramp.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • NE

    Offshore driller Noble (NE +2%) is trading higher this morning after posting a mixed Q4...

    Offshore driller Noble (NE +2%) is trading higher this morning after posting a mixed Q4 yesterday. Profit rose 29% Y/Y on better contract revenue as the company has invested billions of dollars in fleet upgrades over the past year, tailoring its efforts toward producers that are willing to pay more for newer vessels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • MIG

    Shares of Meadowbrook Insurance (MIG -9.8%) lose ground after the firm takes on a downgrade from...

    Shares of Meadowbrook Insurance (MIG -9.8%) lose ground after the firm takes on a downgrade from Keefe, Bruyette & Woods to Market Perform from Outperform. Analysts with the firm cite a Q4 reserve charge the insurance concern is taking and their estimate for lower FY11 and FY12 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA -5.5%) drops back down after racking up a double-digit gain yesterday when a...

    NuVasive (NUVA -5.5%) drops back down after racking up a double-digit gain yesterday when a federal court denied Medtronic's (MDT -0.3%) request for a permanent inunction. It's not the end of the road for the company with more courtroom battles upcoming to see if it will have to pay a $101M jury award for patent infringement.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • KNX

    Knight Transportation (KNX +4.5%) trades up after its Q4 results topped street estimates,...

    Knight Transportation (KNX +4.5%) trades up after its Q4 results topped street estimates, despite weaker margins due to high fuel prices. Profit rose 23% Y/Y as the trucker racked up higher average revenue per tractor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -3.3%) shares have dived over the last 30 minutes of trading. The...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -3.3%) shares have dived over the last 30 minutes of trading. The apparent trigger is a report that Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) will be launching a rival single-serve coffee machine this spring.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • MOH

    Government healthcare services provider Molina Healthcare (MOH +2.30%) says Medicaid expansion...

    Government healthcare services provider Molina Healthcare (MOH +2.30%) says Medicaid expansion continues to be brisk, despite cutbacks in government spending. As a result, FY12 earnings will be ahead of Wall Street estimates. The company now expects a full-year EPS of $1.80 on revenue of $6.1B, while analysts were expecting $1.77 on $5.5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • CTXS

    Citrix Systems (CTXS -2.7%) continues to trade lower after posting its Q4 report, as an in-line...

    Citrix Systems (CTXS -2.7%) continues to trade lower after posting its Q4 report, as an in-line revenue figure overshadows an EPS beat. There are also concerns about Citrix's guidance for Q1 EPS of $0.49-$0.51 ($0.56 consensus) and 2012 EPS of $2.70-$2.74 ($2.79 consensus), the result of heavy sales investments. Needham (Buy) believes these investments will boost 2H growth. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • JCP

    The two-day Ron Johnson-apalooza (webcast: day 1, day 2) CC deciphering J.C. Penney's (JCP...

    The two-day Ron Johnson-apalooza (webcast: day 1, day 2) CC deciphering J.C. Penney's (JCP +10.1%) new strategy is over with mostly favorable reviews on the CEO's vision - not to mention enthusiasm. RJ unplugged: "I think when we look back, we'll see we were in the cave people days of the intersection of the online store and the physical store."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • LEN

    Shares of home builders (XHB -1.7%) slide after the weak report on new home sales, which...

    Shares of home builders (XHB -1.7%) slide after the weak report on new home sales, which "continue to bounce around at low levels - the 307,000 reading for December is little different than the 309,000 average for the fourth quarter and the 303,000 average for 2011 as a whole," RDQ Economics says. LEN -3.2%, DHI -3%, NVR -3.6%, KBH -3.4%, RYL -4.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • MRK

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX -7.6%) says the SEC is requesting more information about its Q3...

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX -7.6%) says the SEC is requesting more information about its Q3 revenue. The request is related to a collaboration and license agreement it has with Bayer to develop and market its first antibiotic drug candidate, torezolid phosphate. The company swung to a profit in that quarter because of payments from its agreement with Bayer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • BGG

    Briggs & Stratton (BGG -8.5%) trades lower after the firm announces that it will consolidate...

    Briggs & Stratton (BGG -8.5%) trades lower after the firm announces that it will consolidate production with plant closings and lowers its full-year EPS guidance to $0.55-$0.81 from a prior range of $1.15-$1.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • GHL

    Greenhill (NYSE:GHL) climbs 11.3% to $48.92 after Q4 earnings beat forecasts, prompting Goldman...
